alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued December 28 at 7:21PM PST until December 30 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST SATURDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, moderate coastal flooding expected. For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of 8 to 13 feet with maximum sets of 15 to 20 feet and dangerous rip currents. Highest surf will be likely across west- facing beaches such as Hermosa, Manhattan, and Palos Verdes Beaches. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of sea water is likely, around the time of high tide, over vulnerable low-lying coastal areas such as parking lots, beaches, and walkways. Significant damage to roads or structures is NOT expected. There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Each morning through Saturday, residual high tides of 6.0 to 6.5 feet will enhance the coastal flooding risk.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Do NOT drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other water side infrastructure.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast
